title: How long should I give a company to issue a refund before filing a chargeback or lawsuit?
question: Sometimes a company will delay the process or ignore your request so how long should I give them? I'm guessing a judge would think 1 week is too short whereas 6 months for a simple refund is obviously intentional.
answers:
30 - 60 days seems reasonable. That would cover 1 billing cycle in which they should be able to issue the refund.

BW

Do it ASAP. You can loose your rights if you wait too long.
